snippet: The New York Times invites readers to join in a conversation about the negotiations for the pending fiscal crisis, the 2012 election and the next four years.
abstract: The New York Times invites readers to join in a conversation about the negotiations for the pending fiscal crisis, the 2012 election and the next four years.
lead_paragraph: The New York Times invites readers to join in a conversation about the negotiations for the pending fiscal crisis, the 2012 election and the next four years. Over on the popular social news site Reddit, David Leonhardt, The Times’s Washington bureau chief, will be hosting an “Ask Me Anything” session. He’ll be answering questions live from 2 p.m. to 3 p.m. Eastern. You can submit your questions now on Reddit and visit Debt Reckoning later for an edited transcript of the session. Read more »

headline.main: David Leonhardt Takes Questions on Reddit
